Action.body: Very simple is using the actual docker interface, from the actual docker client Fabric currently uses, to auto generate a mock. That leaves us with 5 lines of code we would have to maintain. That's about as simple as it gets. This is a remnant of a bygone era, before we had counterfeiter and mockery. We need to standardize and cleanup the codebase. We now have tools to generate the mock that didn't exist in Fabric when it was written, and we should be using them. Just because something works, doesn't mean it's the best way. It's ugly, unclean, and requires maintaining. This is part of our hygiene tasks intended to cleanup the polluted codebase.
